intro: Marrubium pannonicum, commonly known as the Pannonian horehound, is a flowering plant native to Central and Eastern Europe. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs. The plant is characterized by its gray-green, hairy leaves and small, blue or purple flowers that bloom in late spring. It thrives in dry, rocky soils and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and wastelands. Marrubium pannonicum is known for its medicinal properties and has been used traditionally in herbal remedies.
